work.position: Course Project - MEMS Fabricated Continuous Sweat Glucose Monitor
work.summary: Worked in an interdisciplinary team of 3 engineers. Explored the possibility of an enzyme-immobilized sweat sensor for continuous glucose monitoring. Contributions included experimenting with semiconductor manufacturing techniques like lithography, masking, Deposition, and etching.

work.company: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
work.position: Course Project - Embedded Package Design of a 100V GaN HEMT Device for EV Applications
work.summary: Worked in an interdisciplinary team of 4 engineers. Engineered and tested a package for state-of-the-art GaN HEMT for EV application. Contributions included material selection for insulators and designing a 4-layer standard stack-up thermal PCB design to increase reliability.

Worked in a team of electrical, computer, and electronics engineers to develop a new Smart Cluster Management Software. Contributions included designing a program to retrieve real-time CPU and network usage for server applications using C-programming in Cent OS, a Linux environment.

work.position: Project - Piezo-Tribo Nanogenerator (PTNG) for Powering Wearable Gadgets
work.summary: Led an interdisciplinary team of 5 students to conduct a research study to develop and engineer a shoe-sole-embedded flexible nanogenerator to power wearable gadgets. Contributions included overseeing the team, organizing and dividing tasks, progress meetings, documentation, and presentations. Earned special mention from the university for innovation and was proposed for government funding.
